meanings.definition: A water-soluble derivative of cellulose used as a thickening agent in food and pharmaceutical products.
meanings.sent1: The carboxymethylcellulose helped thicken the soup.
meanings.sent2: Food companies often use carboxymethylcellulose to make sauces thicker.
meanings.sent3: The carboxymethylcellulose in the pudding made it so thick, it could stand on its own!
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like carboxymethylcellulose, adding substance to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The carboxymethylcellulose transformed the liquid into a dense gel.

meanings.definition: A synthetic polymer used in various industries for its thickening, stabilizing, and emulsifying properties.
meanings.sent1: The carboxymethylcellulose improved the texture of the paint.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers rely on carboxymethylcellulose for its stabilizing effects in cosmetics.
meanings.sent3: The carboxymethylcellulose in the glue made it so sticky, it stuck to everything!
meanings.sent4: His words acted as carboxymethylcellulose, holding the team together.
meanings.sent5: The carboxymethylcellulose created a smooth consistency in the lotion.
